intro: Freycinetia palawanensis var. palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan freycinetia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the palms family, Arecaceae, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
